\Hypertarget{classdjango_1_1contrib_1_1staticfiles_1_1storage_1_1HashedFilesMixin_a2814ba00e1311ca7b3dc381da1b31c8f}\label{classdjango_1_1contrib_1_1staticfiles_1_1storage_1_1HashedFilesMixin_a2814ba00e1311ca7b3dc381da1b31c8f} 
\index{django.contrib.staticfiles.storage.HashedFilesMixin@{django.contrib.staticfiles.storage.HashedFilesMixin}!post\_process@{post\_process}}
\index{post\_process@{post\_process}!django.contrib.staticfiles.storage.HashedFilesMixin@{django.contrib.staticfiles.storage.HashedFilesMixin}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{post\_process()}{post\_process()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily django.\+contrib.\+staticfiles.\+storage.\+Hashed\+Files\+Mixin.\+post\+\_\+process (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{self,  }\item[{}]{paths,  }\item[{}]{dry\+\_\+run = {\ttfamily False},  }\item[{\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}\texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}}]{options }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

\begin{DoxyVerb}Post process the given dictionary of files (called from collectstatic).

Processing is actually two separate operations:

1. renaming files to include a hash of their content for cache-busting,
   and copying those files to the target storage.
2. adjusting files which contain references to other files so they
   refer to the cache-busting filenames.

If either of these are performed on a file, then that file is considered
post-processed.
\end{DoxyVerb}
